entry.title: Unable to trigger planning sequence through Scripts(Button) in SAC Planning
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I'm having input template once data it is saved it need to run planning sequence.

I have created a button and written the code, but its failing can anyone help on this or provide alternate code

1) Planning sequence has 4 mandatory variables.

2) As soon as the user open the input template, user fill the variables that need to save in placeholder, once it is saved sequentially it need to trigger the planning sequence

Below is the code which I'm trying

Below is the place holder holding user feeded values in below for 4 variables

Moving Unique ProfitCneter to Unique_PC array
 for (var a = 0; a < MS1.length; a++) {
 if (! Unique_MS1.includes(MS1[a])) {
 Unique_MS1.push(MS1[a]).
 }
 }

// //Moving Unique mpFlag to Unique_RF1 array
 for (var b = 0; b < VER.length; b++) {
if (!Unique_VER.includes(VER[b])) {
Unique_VER.push(VER[b]).
 }
 }

// //Moving Unique Hour to Unique_RlH array
 for (var c = 0; c < CC.length; c++) {
 if (!Unique_CC.includes(CC[c])) {
 Unique_CC.push(CC[c]).
}
 }

// //Moving Unique Fiscper to Unique_FPER1 array
 for (var d = 0; d < CCO.length; d++) {
 if (!Unique_CCO.includes(CCO[d])) {
 Unique_CCO.push(CCO[d]);
 }
 }

 

 PS_1.getBpcPlanningSequenceDataSource().setVariableValue("Z4CCINX02_MSTARTEND",{values:Unique_PC});
 PS_1.getBpcPlanningSequenceDataSource().setVariableValue("Z4CISNY02_VERSIONWVC",{values:Unique_RF1});
 PS_1.getBpcPlanningSequenceDataSource().setVariableValue("Z4NIMMN01_COSTCTR",{values:Unique_RIH});
 PS_1.getBpcPlanningSequenceDataSource().setVariableValue("Z4NIMMN01_COMPCODE",{values:Unique_FPER1});


 var publicVersion = Table_1.getPlanning().getPublicVersion("All Versions");

 if (publicVersion.isDirty())
 {
 PS_1.execute();
 publicVersion.publish();
 }

 

Please do the needful, 

Thanks, and regards!

@Sac

entry.title: SAC Live reports are not working in incognito mode for Edge and Chrome
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are facing issue where all our BW live reports are not working in Incognito Mode. This is the case in Edge and Chrome both. We see this could be due to the browser configuration changes. Mostly due to 3rd party cookies being blocked in Incognito mode.

As the browser configuration is managed at Organization level, it is difficult to things unblocked.

Any idea how to overcome this situation?

 

Regards,

Sayed

entry.title: Hi, need help with data action code where we have to divide amount based on two different cross sect
entry.content:
Hi, need help with data action code where we have to divide amount based on two different cross sections. So in cross-section 1 we have the data at a "wave" and "Region" level. In cross section 2 we have the data aggregated at a "wave" level. , so my desired output shall be to get the proportion of each "Region" in a "Wave". As for example if there are 10 regions under a wave, the DA should give me output in Region1/Wave1, Region2/Wave1 and so on. Attaching the excel with the cross sections of dataset.

cross section 1        
         
sr noYearWaveRegionExAudit TrailAmount  
12022ABC006B04002#PARA294000  
22022ABC006B01159#PARA3987000  
32022ABC003X21019#PARA80040  
42022ABC003X260809#PARA86074770  
         
         
         
Cross Section 2:        
         
sr noYearWaveRegionExAudit TrailAmount  
12022ABC003##PARA85994730  
22022ABC006##PARA4281000  
         
         
desired output        
         
sr noYearWaveRegionExAudit TrailAmountOutputOutput
12022ABC006B04002#PARA294000=H24/H180.068675543
22022ABC006B01159#PARA3987000=H25/H180.931324457
32022ABC003X21019#PARA80040=H26/H170.000930755
42022ABC003X260809#PARA86074770=H27/H171.000930755

entry.title: SAC scripting to filter WBS Top members where measure BC (Costs) > 0 and Blank (BW Live Connection)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) with a BW Live Connection.
In my story, the main table (Table_1) contains dimension such as WBS along with the measure BaseCost.

My requirement is:
I want to automatically filter or select only those WBS  members where BaseCost > 0 and Blank using SAC scripting, without creating a flag or calculated field in the BW query.

I tried using getResultSet() and setDimensionFilter() as shown in SAP Community examples, but my script is not filtering correctly when BaseCost is zero and Blank. I have given below the script what I used.

Could you help with script for this type of requirement (measure-based dimension filtering in BW live model)?
Also, please confirm whether this kind of filtering in scripting affects performance for around 30 WBS members.

Thank you,
Raju

 

// Get data source from the table
var ds = Table_1.getDataSource();

// Get the visible result set (only the displayed members)
var rs = ds.getResultSet();

// Create a typed array to hold the filtered WBS IDs
var wbsList = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);

// Loop through each visible row
for (var i = 0; i < rs.length; i++) {
var row = rs[i];
var wbs = row["WBS"];
var baseCost = row["BaseCost"];

if (wbs && wbs.id && baseCost && baseCost.formattedValue) {
var val = baseCost.formattedValue;

// keep if BaseCost > 0 or blank ("-")
if (val === "-" || Number(val) > 0) {
wbsList.push(wbs.id);
}
}
}

// Apply the filter if list is not empty
if (wbsList.length > 0) {
ds.setDimensionFilter("WBS", wbsList);
} else {
ds.removeDimensionFilter("WBS");
}

// optional: check in console
console.log(wbsList);

Is there a way to move the data back to ECC and does it have any specific limitation?

Thanks & Regards,

Pranav Vyas

entry.title: SAP Analytics cloud - unbooked members in live connection query dimension
entry.content:
Hello,

I have live connection to BW4HANA system. There is dimension on which i want to set a filter (by range). The problem I'm facing is that whenever I try to set up  a fixed date filter on this dimension, I get following error. 

So I checked the data in SAC model and there are quite a lot of unbooked data contains date that have no values for key figures. I gues these unbooked members are reason why I'm having problem with a filter ?
I checked the query designer, try to add zero suppress for rows and cols, but still without a change. 
Is there some option in BW query to turn off sending of these unbooked data ? Is there some solution for this problem ?

Thank you for your answers, 

The characteristic I want to filter is a custom one, here are the settings:

entry.title: How can I connect SAP Customer Data Platform (CDP) to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently exploring integration options between SAP Customer Data Platform (CDP) and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to enable analytics and dashboarding based on CDP data. 

As far as I know, SAC does not currently offer a direct live connection to SAP CDP. However, I’m trying to understand what would be the best possible architecture to bring CDP data into SAC — for example, by using SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) (or any equivalent integration layer).

My goal is to:

  • Enable reporting and visualization of CDP data in SAC

  • Stay within SAP’s supported and recommended integration patterns

I would like to know:

  1. Is there any standard or recommended approach for connecting SAP CDP to SAC (directly or indirectly)?

  2. Can SAP CPI act as an intermediary layer — for example, exposing an OData API or using the SAC Data Import Service API to push data into SAC?

If anyone has implemented a similar scenario or can share documentation, architecture examples, or experiences, that would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance for your insights.

Recep

entry.title: IPS: Global User ID
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to provision the „Global User ID“  from IAS (Source System: Local Identity Directory) into the „USER ID“ field in SAC. However, I keep getting the following error:

system=Target SAC - Source IAS

error=HTTP operation failed invoking https://iastenant.analytics.cloud.sap/api/v1/scim2/Users with statusCode: 400, Response: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"400","scimType":"mutability","detail":"Request is unparsable, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema."},

content=<hidden content> - Set property ips.trace.failed.entity.content=true to display the content of failed entities

Here is the transformation code of target System  SAC:

{

    "user": {

        "condition": "isValidEmail($.emails[0].value) && (('%sac.group.prefix%' === 'null') || ($.groups[?(@.display =~ /%sac.group.prefix%.*/)] empty false))",

        "mappings": [

            {

                "constant": [

                    "urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters",

                    "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"

                ],

                "targetPath": "$.schemas"

            },

            {

                "sourceVariable": "entityIdTargetSystem",

                "targetPath": "$.id"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.userName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.name.givenName",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.name.givenName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.name.middleName",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.name.middleName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.name.familyName",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.name.familyName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.displayName",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.displayName"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.externalId",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.externalId"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.active",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.active"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.emails",

                "preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,

                "targetPath": "$.emails"

            },

            {

                "condition": "$.emails[0].length() > 0",

                "constant": true,

                "targetPath": "$.emails[0].primary"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.groups[*].value",

                "preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.groups[?(@.value)]",

                "functions": [

                    {

                        "function": "resolveEntityIds",

                        "entityType": "group"

                    }

                ]

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$.emails[0].value",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['idpUserId']"

            },

            {

                "condition": "$.emails[?(@.primary == true)].value != []",

                "sourcePath": "$.emails[?(@.primary == true)].value",

                "preserveArrayWithSingleElement": false,

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['idpUserId']"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['idpUserId']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:sap:params:scim:schemas:extension:sac:2.0:user-custom-parameters']['idpUserId']"

            },

            {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User']['manager']['value']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User']['manager']['value']",

                "functions": [

                    {

                        "function": "resolveEntityIds"

                    }

                ]

            }

        ]

    }

}

In the code, I changed this from userName to userUuid :          

  {

                "sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']",

                "optional": true,

                "targetPath": "$.userName"

            },

Could you please help me identify what I might be doing wrong? The error suggests the request is syntactically incorrect or violates the schema, but I’m not sure what part of the payload might be causing this.

Thank you very much for your help!

Best Regards

entry.title: Missing data in SAC Data Analyzer table vs. S/4HANA Report Monitor query result
entry.content:
Hi All ,

I am experiencing a discrepancy between the cost center list displayed in the Data Analyzer table in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Vs what is shown in the Report Monitor in S/4HANA.

Issue Description

  • The Data Analyzer table is connected to a live model created from a standard CDS view in S/4HANA.
  • When the account hierarchy is set to Level 1, the table correctly shows the total number of cost centers. Table has cost center , account & one more dimension in row , 12 months in the column. 
  • However, when I drill down to the lowest hierarchy level for the account, the resulting cost center list is incomplete. For example, SAC table displays only 20 cost centers instead of 50 concenters data. 
  • In contrast, the underlying CDS view in the Report Monitor (S/4HANA) displays the full set of cost centers.

Observations

  • The only notable difference is the presentation: the Report Monitor displays results in flat structure from the hierarchy view in SAC.
  • I have reviewed several SAP notes regarding table limitations. 3563348 - Data Analyzer : No 'Edit Drill Limitation' option in Data analyzer indicate that Data Analyzer does not have a drill limitation. Despite this, I notice that applying less filters, decreases the cost centers list in the SAC table.
  • I understand that minimizing filters is generally advisable for performance, but finance analysts typically prefer exporting a complete dataset to Excel for detailed offline analysis. Loading the full list in a browser for analysis is less practical.

Please help with the following questions. 

  • Why is the cost center list in SAC Data Analyzer incomplete when the drill level is set to the lowest account hierarchy level, despite no indicated drill limitation?
  • Are there specific workarounds or best practices to enable analysts to export the full dataset (similar to what is available in S/4HANA Report Monitor)?
  • Is there additional documentation or SAP notes that address this specific scenario or known limitation?

Thank you in advance for your support and guidance.

Regards,

Krishna.

entry.title: Fix Year For Each Version
entry.content:
Hi everyone, 

I am facing a problem in SAC that I have a planning model and the start date and end date of the planning model is set to 2024-2027 and the Granularity is set to Year and Hierarchy is also set to Year and and in my story I have different Versions created in the same table like Version_1 as Actual, Version_2 then Version_3 and Version_4

and only Version_1 Actual and Version_2 Data is Falling there from S/4HANA and other versions are for the planning

But I need to fix the date dimensions range for Version_1 Actual should only show me 2024-2025 and not like 2024-2027 same goes for each version like Version_2 should only show me Year for 2025-2026 and then Version_3 should show me 2026-2027 

and for this purpose I have made a property in my Version Dimension like START/END/DATE and under that in text i have written all things but it is only read only it do not make the posting correct so if anyone has any idea on this do let me now and I don't want to filter the versions or the YEAR because I am doing Budget Planning and I want to see all the versions so If any one has a solution do guide
---------------

entry.title: SAC - Time Dimention ID and Description: sorting and labeling
entry.content:
Hi expects,

We have configured a bar chart where we show accumulated data along different time options: Hours, Days, weeks, months and years. They want to switch along them (being selected only one by one) in order to see the different accumulated data.


Focusing in Hours (type: String) :

  • customer wants to see the members like: HH DD-MM-YYYY 
  • Originally members comes from Datasphere like: YYYY-MM-DD HH

The problem here comes with the sorting: Sorting must go ascending (obviously):

  • For YYYY-MM-DD HH format works fine: 2025-09-01 10, 2025-09-01 11, 2025-09-01 12 and so on
  • For HH DD-MM-YYYY , the sorting works like: 10 01-09-2023, 10 01-09-2024, 10 01-09-2025 and so on

The only chance I think we have is to set up the dimension in this way:

  • ID must be with YYYY-MM-DD HH format and then the sorting will work following the ID
  • Description Must be with format HH DD-MM-YYYY and theoretically

Is there any way to do this? Any suggestion? Thank you in advance!

entry.title: SAC error "We couldn't connect to your BW system"
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

One user is facing error while running the SAC story based on BW live model. Error is ""We couldn't connect to your BW system. Please ask your system administrator to investigate".

Below investigation was done but still issue is not resolved -

  • User is able to login to SAC
  • Can run a Dashboard based on Import Model.
  • Can run AFO report
  • Can not run any live SAC dashboards (tested with multiple dashboards based on BW live models) - So issue is with BW live stories only and specific to the user
  • Shared underlying models and story with view access
  • Tried in Edge and incognito
  • Tried in Chrome and incognito
  • Tried by deleting cache
  • Security team confirmed that user has backend authorizations.
  • User is on VPN
  • Users SSO certificate is valid and trusted
  • User is able to run this link-https://XXXX:XX/sap/bw/ina/GetServerInfo in his browser and getting result.
  • All other users are able to run the report

Could you please suggest? Are there any other tests that user need to do for fixing the issue?

Thanks in advance! 

Thanks,

How can I go about enabling this?

entry.title: Styling Rules Bug New Table Build Experience
entry.content:
We have changed the table type. Since the styling rules were not preserved, we recreated them. The issue is that although the styling rules work correctly in edit mode, they stop working in view mode.

This didn't happen before, so we believe this may be a bug related to the new table type.
